review_title: Provides high value services for entrepreneurs and small business owners.
pros: - Knowledgeable, professional colleagues. Excellent onboarding and resources. Collaborative work environment. Strong social purpose that benefits the economy and business community.
cons: Would like to see more robust electronic collaboration tools.

pros: I worked in the San Francisco office. The mentors who volunteer to help new small business owners really know their stuff. This free service really can assist those not only starting a business, but running it successfully. I loved both the mentors, clients, and the SBA people I had to interact with.
cons: SCORE outsources to Panther Group to actually employ. They only give you six paid holidays, the others are unpaid days off which is not so good. Health care is extra and you get it through their Panther. It costs a lot so it can really eat up a weekly paycheck.

review_title: The Hottest Place on the Planet
pros: The staff is incredible; fun, energetic and gorgeous. The owners always have your back. I would take a bullet for this place.
cons: Staff and events can be overwhelming and chaotic at times. You have to reign them in.

pros: good work culture, good growth
cons: nothing to say in cons

job_title: Social Media Coordinator in Springfield, MA
pros: Good position to work with insightful people
cons: N/A. there is nothing to complain

pros: You can learn from very eery experienced people.
cons: Tehir scheduling system needs improvement.

pros: This is a fantastic organization for individuals with years of business experience and knowledge that want to give back to the entrepreneurial community. It is a VOLUNTEER position, whereby you give your time to meet and counsel individuals who want to start or grow a business.  Your colleagues are friendly, knowledgeable and have a breath of experience from which you are always learning.  The clients can be stimulating and the work very rewarding. Hours are flexible.
cons: This is a serious commitment of time. It should not be entered into lightly.  It requires time for orientation and ongoing time to meet with clients. There is NO PAY.    Additionally, the main office location at 26 Federal Plaza presents challenges for entry as it is a high security government building,, but there are many other places that you can meet clients and thus this issue can be avoided.  Diversity among the team is always an issue, but that is just based on the people that come to volunteer.  The organization makes efforts to be inclusive.

pros:
Virtual internship: I had the flexibility of completing my duties at SCORE Philadelphia anywhere.
Great staff: Shauna Howard, VP of Membership (at my time there), was a very pleasant and resourceful guide throughout my internship.
Awesome learning experience: I was able to acquaint myself with aspiring entrepreneurs and small business owners in the Philadelphia area, which was a lot of fun. I exercised my writing, social, and business skills all at the same time at SCORE Philadelphia, which allowed me to grow professionally and personally.
cons: At first, I did not know exactly how to complete my tasks because of how unfamiliar with the position I was. I also had a tough time landing clients to speak with. Ultimately, I successfully completed all my duties with SCORE Philadelphia and I have very little negative to say other than this.

review_title: Desperately in Need of New Management and Leadership
pros:
1. Flex-time
2. The mission and goals
cons:
1. Senior staff needs management skills training, coaching on how to be honest and professional in a workplace
2. Strategic planning does not exist at this organization
3. Accountability to CEO is non-existent
4. Staff are treated very poorly and much differently than senior staff 
5. There is no designated HR department so if you have an issue, you are out of luck 
6. The benefits are pathetic - no health insurance for dependents is just one of the problems 
7. The office building is in horrible condition-looks more like a storage space than an office
8. Technology used is outdated 
9. Lacking diversity and no intentions to improve this

job_title: Administrative Assistant Volunteer in Glendale, NY
pros: SCORE, with so many mentors, professionals, for all people that want to open a small business is a bless. There are so many mentors, from sales to construction, administration to accounting. To open a business, these professionals, mentors, help FOR FREE!
cons: This is a volunteer organization. I wish I could have a permanent payable job with them.
